posts.author: EatPreyLuv
posts.content:
1) PvM or PvP - A little of both but I prioritize PVM

2) Level cap - 20

3) Race preference - Half-orc, or Human

4) Class preference - Cleric with any multiclass but would prefer it mostly be cleric

5) Melee preference - Any weapon and board (shield)

6) Range preference - Spells

7) Weapon preference - Anything that fits a tribal shaman or claw-like or just destroys in melee

8) Maximum item enhancement - +4/+5 AC +1/+2 with very rare +3 stat

9) Spellcasting - Spell casting would be to buff or call malar allies. Server gives players ability to turn any summon into any NPC so I can turn any summon into a Malar Panther.

10) Custom factors - COT Alignment restrictions removed, Dwarven Defender racial restrictions removed, AA racial restrictions removed, PDK alignment restrictions removed. No real change to cleric spells but heavy changes to arcane.

No Listen or Spot because I assumed Malar panthers will get true sight (and you will too), also assumed your PW uses the default OP true seeing.

Domains.
Animal is there for the flavour, but if you're going to turn it into panthers anyway it might not matter (but I guess the panthers scale based on summon level?)
If the only slot that boosts Wisdom AND natural armour is the amulet, consider Plant for Barkskin.
Strength is almost mandatory with 15 cleric levels, you WANT two levels of extended Divine Power. I left BAB at 15 for maximum DP goodness.
Consider Travel if you cannot get Haste easily.
Consider Trickery if you cannot get Invisibility easily or otherwise get the jump on mages.
Consider War in every other case. Cat's grace is nice, but Aura of Vitality is fantastic in low-magic settings.

Craft Wand for your sex toy collection many panthers and also everything else, since there are many level 1-4 cleric spells that are incredibly useful in a pinch but you don't want to waste slots on them normally. If panthers are very much affected by summon level, consider taking scribe scroll instead as a slower (to read out than to flick a wand) and more expensive but also more powerful option.

Your reflex saves are terrible. Consider taking Lightning Reflexes instead of Called Shot, but you'll still fail every check ;)

Tumble and UMD come late, but it's something to look forward to.

20% XP penalty for the very last level. You can take rogue at 20 to avoid it. You can take rogue as early as level 17 if XP is not a concern.

You can swap your starting Dex and Con.

I'm not a pro builder by any means, criticism and suggestions welcome.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you want to be mostly Cleric, I would suggest 1 or maybe 2 levels of Fighter for free martial Weapons and 1 or 2 additional feats, and all the rest Cleric.  Although it is not very claw-like, the warhammer is excellent for clerics because it can smash undead with blunt damage, but also has x3 criticals for those enemies who are susceptible to them.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This is a tough RP build to get right. Much depends on interpretation.
There is no claw like weapon for player characters, unless you can polymorph into animal or beast/ monster shape. I read somewhere that Malarites are never without daggers. And maybe some axes may look a bit claw-like. Here I suggest Kukri with it's tusk-, horn- or claw like shape.

The AB is strength based and will benefit from Bull's and Divine power. Animal domain gives stronger summons and Cat's can buff summons as well as the character itself, which enables lighter armor, such as Hides or Scale mail. I have problems seeing this savage priest of beasts roleplayed in full plate and tower.

Malarite clerics often multiclass with Babarian, Ranger or Druid. These classes all have some to offer, but IMO not enough to make it worth it. I prefer rogue and see nothing wrong with it RP wise. It has much to offer with class skills, evasion and UD.

The 16/4 class split ends with level 8 spells. You may disagree and rather take a 2/18 or 3/17 split for level 9 spells. It costs 1 BAB and force you to increase wisdom. But clerics are extremely powerful and can live well with any of those splits.

This is meant to be a RP build. I will ask you to see the build as a draft. I am not quite sure if I have found the best solution. It can be changed in many ways, depending on your RP preferences or a wish for more power.
